data.title: High Performance Research Computing, Texas A&M University
data.description: Since 1989, the High Performance Research Computing (HPRC) group, formerly the Supercomputing Facility, has been dedicated to be a resource for research and discovery at Texas A&M University. We support more than 2,000 users including more than 400 faculty members. Our users use our computing resources for cutting edge, collaborative, and transformative research including, but not limited to, materials development, quantum optimization, and climate prediction. We will continue to promote emerging computing technology to researchers, and assist them in using it for research and discovery.

data.title: Texas A&M University
data.caption: Grader under Professor Leyk for CSCE 221 - Data Structures
data.description: üìö I was selected by Texas A&M University Computer Science department to become a grader.

experiences.content:
- Managed assignments, homework, and exams of 70 undergraduate CS students for CSCE 221 Data Structures.
- Accelerated grading process leveraging Python scripts for automation, reducing grading time by 90%.

data.title: Oracle
data.post: Cloud + DevOps Engineer (Member of Technical Staff)
data.caption: My first developer experience in the industry out of college. Cloud + DevOps.
data.description: Oracle Cloud is the first public cloud built from the ground up to be a better cloud for every application. By rethinking core engineering and systems design for cloud computing, we created innovations that solve problems that customers have with existing public clouds. We accelerate migrations of existing enterprise workloads, deliver better reliability and performance for all applications, and offer the complete services customers need to build innovative cloud applications.

experiences.content:
- Created a large-scale distributed system platform built on Oracle Kubernetes Engine enabling users to orchestrate custom Kubernetes clusters with pre-configured configurations suited to requirements.
- Devised microservices architecture and orchestrated automation of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure(OCI) resources deployment leveraging Docker and Terraform(Infrastructure as Code tools).
- Mentored 5 associate software engineers to develop and maintain Bitbucket CI/CD pipeline deployment processes across different environments reducing deployment failure by 90%.
- Collaborated to build a Kubernetes Prometheus stack (kube-prometheus), including kube-state-metrics and node-exporter for cluster monitoring and observability using Golang.
- Engineered Grafana dashboards to enable cluster administrators to query, visualize, and understand target metrics data stored in Prometheus.
- Applied canary deployments for control plane to compare, test, and observe behavior of any update made to service using Java-based JUnit test cases.
- Installed alarms for different OCI resources by fetching defined metrics to get notifications regarding resources health, capacity, and performance-related issues.
- Demonstrated proficiency in incident response, system monitoring, and automation, contributing to improving system reliability and ensuring adherence to Service Level Agreement during on-call support.

data.title: dhiyo.ai
data.caption: Built the MVP as a Flutter developer.
data.description: üèó Dhiyo leverages state-of-the-art NLP(U) and ML techniques to deliver the industry's most robust and engaging conversational experience. Through open-ended, natural and dynamic conversations, we are able to gather deep candidate insights and build trust and confidence with our job seekers and connecting them with right employers.

experiences.content:
- Spearheaded mobile application development for the MVP launch built on Flutter and Firebase.
- Accomplished over 100,000 downloads on the Google Play Store over months.
